service

Class JSONHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.JSONHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler

    public class JSONHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler
    Processes a request from a client for JSON validation.

    The class reads a payload in the request (means HTTP POST request) and tries to parse the JSON using Google Gson library. If parsing was successful then the same JSON is sent, though it is pretty print first, i.e. formatted for better human readability. It sends JSON with error details in case of violation of the format rules.

    JVS uses Google Gson library which is able to deserialize a JSON described in RFC 7159. Thus error-handling is based on the messages from the com.google.gson.stream.JsonReader.java. Yet these messages are well-described to be used by JVS.

    If a JSON is malformed, the error message is sent such as the following: 

         "errorCode"  : 12345,
     "errorMessage" : "verbose, plain language description of the problem with hints about how to fix it",
     "errorPlace" : "the point where error has occurred",
     "resource"   : "filename",
     "request-id" : "the request id generated by the API for easier tracking of errors"
    • errorCode is a value listed in BadJSONResponse.ERRORS or zero if some unhandled error is occurred
    • errorMessage and errorPlace are taken from the caught exception that is thrown by Gson's JsonReader.
    • resource a name that is retrieved from a HTTP request URI (path)
    • request-id an id of a request that is unique for the session

    So when JVS determines that a JSON is not valid, it builds BadJSONResponse object with fields as described above and serializes it to JSON format. Then JVS sends this JSON as a response for a client. HTTP status code for any response is 200.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        public void handle(com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpExchange t)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Performs validation of a client request.

        The callback invokes by HttpServer on incoming request from a client. It reads a payload from a request and performs validation. If validation is complete, it sends HTTP OK response with Content-Type: application/vnd.api+json.

        Specified by:
        handle in interface com.sun.net.httpserver.HttpHandler
        Parameters:
        t - HttpExchange instance passing by HttpServer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if sending a response is not possible.
